abstract.p: Two toddlers are attacked by dog, described by police as either a Rottweiler or a pit bull, in Jamaica, Queens; both children are hospitalized (S)

block.p: Two toddlers were attacked by a dog outside the Loving Arms Day Care Center at 156-04 113th Avenue in Jamaica, Queens, yesterday.

The dog, described by the police as either a Rottweiler or a pit bull, followed an unidentified woman onto the porch of the center, where it bit a 2-year-old boy, whose lip, face and right shoulder were injured, the police said. The day care operator chased the dog away, hitting it with a broom, but it attacked a 4-year-old boy outside, injuring his left arm, the police said.

The day care operator chased the dog away, hitting it with a broom, but it attacked a 4-year-old boy outside, injuring his left arm, the police said.

The children were taken to St. John's Queens Hospital, where the younger one, Orion Kitt, was in serious but stable condition and the older one, Joshua Charles, was in stable condition, the police said.
The dog was tranquilized and will be tested for rabies, the police said.
